-- Noir --

Noir steps out of the now useless stasis chamber's chair. Her joints 
were a little unused from the long period of unawareness, but she 
ignored that problem. Use would wear them in.

<Noir.> The word, or perhaps name, still remains part of her passive 
thoughts, sitting in the back of her mind like an unmistakeable 
signature of her passing. "Noir." Her soft cold voice says quietly 
to nobody in particular as she excercises her joints momentarily to 
ensure their ability to function.

Her hands absent mindedly slide into specific locations, her right 
had on her right hip, and her left had behind her back. Pistols pop 
out of hidden slots, and she fingers them gingerly, looking them 
over slowly before putting them back.

Her eyes scan the room, and rest on a mid sized table which has a 
electronic device sitting on it in the middle of the room. 
Cautiously, she walks over to the table, but before she can 
touch the device, an interactive hologram flickered into existance 
above it. 

"Noir." The image said. "Welcome to the Rogues base of the moment."

Noir eyes the holo warily, "... Keep talking." The image then 
strikes her memmory, and she seems to remmeber this figure... 
Devilcat, the Rogue leader.

"You are to contact the active rogues immediately for your current 
orders. And try not to delay." The image finished.

<Shoulda had something more... important to say... oh well> She 
checks to see that she has everything, then quietly leaves the room. 
Her memory showed her where everything was located. It seemed that 
she'd been here before for a long time, and knew it like the back of 
her hand. Knowing this, she made the trip to the control room as 
quick as possible.

Unafraid of running into any other bots, she walks right into the 
control and communications room, her eyes scanning the room right 
from the instant she had entered.

(is there anyone in the Rogue base? or is Noir going to have to 
contact the others.)

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "x_rauq_x" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
> Somwehere in the Rogue base, in the center of a darkened inactive 
> room in the crew quarters, a moderately sided stasis cell flickers 
> to life. The liquid crystal display shows an increasing reactivity 
> of the bot contained, which quickly levels off as it approaches a 
> normal bot's functioning range.
> 
> The chamber slides upward with an initially intense hiss, which 
> gradually tapers off into an abrupt click as the chamber finishes 
> rising from over top of the bot which it had been covering. 
> 
> <Awake...> thoughts trickle through the newly awakened bot's logic 
> centers as its sensors begin to take in the surroundings. The 
bot's 
> greyish visor turns slightly. The inpenitrable darkness is quickly 
> washed away into a view of green and black which, the bot decides, 
> could only mean night vision of sorts. The bot's vision was then 
> interupted as the visor's green-black sight became bluish with 
> reddish shapes around what must be heat sources.
> 
> <It has been a while.> If thoughts could have temperature, these 
> ones could have caused in ice age. <This form... ahh yes, it is 
all 
> coming back to me.> Images of a lith black form weilding black and 
> silver slienced pistols dodge weapon fire, and place three well 
> aimed armour piercing bullets into a bot of unknown origin's 
optics 
> and central cicuitry flash through her logic center as it acesses 
> the bot's history.
> 
> All the history files ended with one word.
> 
> <...Noir...>
